File Upload Advanced Learn More

Configuration Options

  1. Advanced File Upload Example View Example
  2. Default File Upload Example View Example

API Details

Settings

  • isStandalone Boolean  -  On page(true) -or- on modal (false) , this is used for some visual style only.
  • allowedTypes Boolean  -  Restrict file types(ie. 'jpg|png|gif') ['*' all types]
  • maxFilesInProcess Boolean  -  Max number of files can be uploaded
  • maxFileSize Boolean  -  Max file size in bytes, -1 for unlimited
  • fileName Boolean  -  Variable name to read from server
  • isDisabled Boolean  -  Make control disabled
  • isBrowse Boolean  -  Add way to browse files to upload
  • send Function  -  Method for send file to upload

Functions

handleFileUpload

Read the file contents using HTML5 FormData()

Parameters

  • files Object  -  File object containing uploaded files.

sendFileToServer

Function you can implement to send data to the server.

Parameters

  • formData Object Contains the form data / file data.
  • status Object Status of the upload operation

enable

Set input to enabled.

disable

Set input to disabled.

teardown

Teardown - Remove added events

destroy

Destroy - Remove added markup and events

Code Example

File Upload Advanced

The advanced file upload control just needs a div in which to draw its contents.



    <div class="fileupload-advanced">
    </div>

Implementation Tips

  • This is done by using an html5 drag drop feature. So is only supported well on IE11 +

Accessibility

  • TODO

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Not keyboard friendly at this time. Will need a browse button.

States and Variations

  • Error
  • Success / Fail

Responsive Guidelines

  • The div will size to parent but recomend default size.
